en.title: ğŸƒ Halloween Scavenger Hunt Cards ğŸƒ

setupGuide.title: ğŸ¯ How to Set Up Your Halloween Scavenger Hunt

steps.title: ğŸ–¨ï¸ Print the Cards
steps.content: Click the "Print Cards" button above to get physical copies. Print on cardstock for best results!

steps.title: ğŸ”„ Hide Cards in Reverse Order
steps.content:
Start with Card 2: Hide it where kids get snacks (kitchen/pantry)
Card 3: Hide under the dinner table
Continue: Each card goes where the previous clue's answer points

steps.title: ğŸ Set Up the Final Prize
steps.content: Hide the ultimate treasure at the front door (or just outside). Make it special - candy bag, small toy, or Halloween treat!

steps.title: ğŸš€ Start the Adventure
steps.content: Hand Card 1 to your kids to begin the hunt. Watch the excitement unfold!

tips.title: ğŸ’¡ Pro Tips
items: Test the difficulty - make sure riddles are challenging but solvable
Set clear boundaries for which areas are "in play"
Hide small treats at each location for extra motivation
Have backup clues ready in case one gets lost
Safety first - ensure all hiding spots are safe and accessible

notifications.fallback: ğŸ“ Using built-in cards (JSON file not accessible)

clues.clue: Find your very first treat, I'm where you get food to eat.
If you want to find a candy, early. You must look under your dinner.
It's too early to quit. Sit on something you sit.
It's time to stop for a drink. Now I'm close to the sink.
You still have more clues. The next one is by your shoes.
I might be hard to see. But I'm close to your TV.
No need to check outside, I'm right at your bedside.
Now I'm in your bed! I'm under where you put your head.
The next clue is what you need. I'm near the books you read.
Find the next clue, if you dare. I'm where you keep your underwear.
Now if you follow this path, You'll find me where you take a bath.
This is your last clue. There won't be anymore. For your final treat, check the front door.
Don't be scared of the dark, I'm hiding where clothes get their spark!
When you're feeling quite cold, I'm where warmth takes hold.
Look where time ticks away, your next clue waits there all day.
I'm cold and quite tall, keeping your food from going bad at all.
Where you hang your clothes so neat, check the place that can't be beat!
When you look at yourself each day, I reflect back in every way.
I have steps but I don't walk, I help you reach up high without talk.
Where dishes get clean and sparkly bright, check this spot both day and night.
I'm the guardian of your home so dear, I keep the weather from getting too near.
When the day is done and you need some rest, look where pillows are at their best.

tasks.task: Do a spooky spider walk across the room (walk on hands and feet with belly up)
Walk like a zombie for 2 minutes - slow, stiff movements with arms out
Carve or draw a spooky face on a pumpkin
Tell everyone a spooky ghost story (at least 1 minute long)
Hang upside down like a bat for 20 seconds (from monkey bars or safe spot)
Create a magic potion using 5 safe ingredients from the kitchen
Create a spider web using string or yarn (at least 50cm wide)
Howl at the moon like a werewolf 5 times
Collect 20 fallen leaves and arrange them by size
Do the skeleton dance - make your body shake like bones rattling for 1 minute
Count backwards from 100 in your spookiest vampire voice
Act like a black cat - stretch, meow, and prowl around for 2 minutes
Put on a spooky costume using things you find around the house
Find 5 things outside that are the same color as the night sky
Jump into a pile of leaves (or make a pile first!)
Predict the future - tell 3 silly fortunes to family members
Create a silly epitaph (gravestone saying) for an imaginary character
Collect 10 different types of natural items from the garden
Build a haunted house using pillows, blankets, and furniture
Do 10 jumping jacks every time someone says 'Halloween'
Search for mushrooms or interesting fungi in the garden (look, don't touch!)
Create a spooky shadow puppet show on the wall (needs flashlight)
PARENT TASK: Help your child create a spooky shadow puppet on the wall
PARENT TASK: Read a Halloween story together with spooky voices
PARENT TASK: Paint Halloween faces together (washable paint only!)
PARENT TASK: Race to collect 10 leaves - parent vs child!
PARENT TASK: Teach your child a spooky Halloween song and sing together
PARENT TASK: Go on a flashlight treasure hunt together in the dark
PARENT TASK: Bake Halloween cookies together (with supervision)
PARENT TASK: Take silly spooky photos together in costumes
